questions.question_text: A developer has created a variable of type String called “MyNumbers” and assigned to it the following value: “1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6”. What is the resulting data type for the expression MyNumbers.Split(“,”c)(1)?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Verified in Studio Using MyNumbers.Split(“,”c)(1).GetType().ToString()

questions.question_text: What are the possible statuses after running any REFramework test case?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Pass or Fail

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B

B is the correct one 
NOTE:
Starting with Citrix Virtual Apps and Desktops 7 2109, all custom virtual channels are blocked by default. This prevents the UiPath Remote Runtime from working correctly. To solve this issue the UiPath virtual channel must be added to the allow list policy:

UIPCTX,C:\Program Files (x86)\UiPath\RemoteRuntime\UiPathRemoteRuntime.exe

https://docs.uipath.com/studio/standalone/2022.10/user-guide/about-uipath-remote-runtime

questions.question_text: Why is it necessary to add the UiPath virtual channel to the allow list policy for Citrix Virtual Apps and Desktops 7 2109?

choices.C: Because the network latency should be decreased and the performance of UiPath automation processes on Citrix should be improved.
choices.D: Because a secure connection should be created between the UiPath Remote Runtime and the Citrix receiver.
choices.B: Because custom virtual channels are blocked by default, preventing the UiPath Remote Runtime from functioning correctly.
choices.A: Because the UiPath Remote Runtime component should be enabled to access the Citrix workspace environment.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is the correct one

D is the correct one
In the UiPath Platform, the WebDriver protocol introduces support for headless browser automations. This means that browser automations don't necessarily have to rely on visual elements on screen, such as window frames. Automations are executed in the background, without you having to keep up the browser window

https://docs.uipath.com/studio/standalone/2022.10/user-guide/about-the-webdriver-protocol

questions.question_text:
A developer plans to create a process to automate a web application using the Firefox browser. The goal is to have the robot work with the web application without relying on visual elements on screen.

To achieve this goal, what option should the developer use for the Use Application/Browser activity?
In order for a developer to utilize the default REFramework without relying on Orchestrator queues, what is the essential prerequisite to ensure that the project does not interact with Orchestrator?

choices.D: Omit the OrchestratorQueueName setting from the Config.xlsx file. Exclude the three SetTransactionStatus activities from the SetTransactionStatus workflow & change the variable type.
choices.B: Eliminate the Get Transaction Data state from the Main state machine. Exclude the Get Transaction Item activity from the project & change the variable type.
choices.A: Remove the Get Transaction Data state from the Main state machine. Remove the OrchestratorQueueName setting from Config.xlsx & change the variable type.
choices.C: Exclude the Get Transaction Item activity from the project. Eliminate the three SetTransactionStatus activities from the SetTransactionStatus workflow & change the variable type.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer is C.

Selected Answer: C
Answer is C

Selected Answer: C
Answer C. C. Exclude the Get Transaction Item activity from the project. Eliminate the three SetTransactionStatus activities from the SetTransactionStatus workflow & change the variable type.
